intro: Struthanthus subcampestris, commonly known as the desert evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers that open in the evening. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
